dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, Host_B, get this. All that talk about how sedentary lifestyles are, like, the absolute worst? Turns out... we might have been completely wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, Host B, get this. All that talk about how sedentary lifestyles are, like, the absolute worst? Turns out we might have been completely wrong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We believe that the internal body scales give an inaccurately low measure when you sit down. As a result you eat more and gain weight, says Ohlsson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, no. Don't tell me. I just got a standing desk! Whatâ€™s the scoop?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, no. Don't tell me. I just got a standing desk! What's the scoop?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, a new study from Sweden's University of Gothenburg, funded by the AIDS Awareness Foundation, no less, suggests that standing isn't actually the solution to weight gain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, a new study from Sweden's University of Gothenburg, funded by the A I D S Awareness Foundation, no less, suggests that standing isn't actually the solution to weight gain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: losing weight and fighting the related obesity epidemic could be as simple as literally taking a stand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? So it's not good for you? That's, um, like, the opposite of everything we've heard for years!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? So it's not good for you? That's, um, like, the opposite of everything we've heard for years!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Professor John-Olov Jansson explains that standing desks actually lead to food cravings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Professor John-Olov Jansson explains that standing desks actually lead to food cravings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the body weight tends to increase, a signal is sent to the brain to decrease food intake and keep the body weight constant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Food cravings? How does that even... [interrupts] How does standing make you crave food?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Food cravings? How does that even How does standing make you crave food?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, the brain sends signals to your lower extremities, telling them to, uh, ignore body weight. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, the brain sends signals to your lower extremities, telling them to, uh, ignore body weight. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The weight of the body is registered in the lower extremities. If the body weight tends to increase, a signal is sent to the brain to decrease food intake and keep the body weight constant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That sounds completely counterintuitive! Did they test this on people?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That sounds completely counterintuitive! Did they test this on people?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope, mice. They implanted weights in their bellies, about 15% of their body mass, and compared them to a control group.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope, mice. They implanted weights in their bellies, about fifteen percent of their body mass, and compared them to a control group.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The study was conducted by implanting weights into the bellies of mice. Some rodents had capsules with weight equivalent to about 15 percent of their body mass implanted while a control group had empty capsules implanted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And what happened to the mice with the added weight?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what happened to the mice with the added weight?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: After a few weeks, they gained massive amounts of body fat. Massive!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: After a few weeks, they gained massive amounts of body fat. Massive!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After a few weeks, the two groups had nearly the same weight, with the mice implanted with added weight apparently making up the difference by shedding white body fat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So it totally messed with their internal system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it totally messed with their internal system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Professor Claes Ohlsson mentioned this hormone, leptin, that hinders fat regulation. And combining that with, like, activated internal body scales? Bad news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. Professor Claes Ohlsson mentioned this hormone, leptin, that hinders fat regulation. And combining that with, like, activated internal body scales? Bad news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The mechanism that we have now identified regulates body fat mass independently of leptin, and it is possible that leptin combined with activation of the internal body scales can become an effective treatment for obesity, said Professor Claes Ohlsson at Gothenburg University.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, if standing is bad, what's the actual recommendation now? Back to our chairs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, if standing is bad, what's the actual recommendation now? Back to our chairs?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] You got it! Treatment will now involve sitting for hours at a time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You got it! Treatment will now involve sitting for hours at a time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And those treatments might start with some of the advice that we're already hearing today: to get up off your seat and on to your feet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously? My couch is my new gym?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously? My couch is my new gym?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kind of! Ohlsson says that when you sit down, your internal body scales give an inaccurately *high* measure, making you eat less and, um, lose weight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kind of! Ohlsson says that when you sit down, your internal body scales give an inaccurately high measure, making you eat less and, um, lose weight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We believe that the internal body scales give an inaccurately low measure when you sit down. As a result you eat more and gain weight, says Ohlsson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, standing could really be killing us because it distorts our body's own picture of how much it weighs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, standing could really be killing us because it distorts our body's own picture of how much it weighs?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In other words, sitting could really be killing us because it distorts the body's own picture of how much it weighs, screwing with the systems that regulate body fat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Basically. It's, like, screwing with the systems that promote body fat. So yeah, maybe ignore that standing desk after all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Basically. It's, like, screwing with the systems that promote body fat. So yeah, maybe ignore that standing desk after all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Looks like you may want to take another look at investing in that standing desk after all.

dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Well, my backside is going to be very happy about this news.
